text: What is your overall testing strategy (unit, integration, end-to-end, performance, security)?
help_text: A comprehensive testing strategy ensures quality across all levels
example_answer: We will use a testing pyramid: 70% unit tests, 20% integration tests, 10% end-to-end tests

text: What are your target code coverage metrics?
help_text: Code coverage targets should be realistic but rigorous
example_answer: We target 80% overall coverage with 100% coverage for critical paths

text: What unit testing frameworks and libraries will you use?
help_text: Unit testing frameworks should be appropriate for your technology stack
example_answer: We will use pytest for Python with fixtures for test setup

text: How will you handle test dependencies and mocking?
help_text: Proper mocking isolates units under test for reliable results
example_answer: We will use unittest.mock and dependency injection for clean test isolation

text: What integration testing approach will you use (APIs, databases, services)?
help_text: Integration tests verify components work correctly together
example_answer: We will test API endpoints with real databases and message queues

text: How will you manage test data and test databases?
help_text: Test data management impacts test reliability and execution time
example_answer: We will use Docker containers for databases and factories for test data generation

text: What end-to-end testing approach will you use?
help_text: End-to-end tests verify complete user workflows
example_answer: We will use Selenium for UI testing and Cypress for modern web applications

text: Which critical user journeys will you test end-to-end?
help_text: Prioritize e2e tests for high-value user workflows
example_answer: We will test user registration, login, purchase flow, and payment processing

text: What performance testing will you implement?
help_text: Performance testing identifies bottlenecks and ensures SLA compliance
example_answer: We will use load testing (1000 concurrent users) and stress testing (gradual load increase)

text: What are your performance SLAs (response time, throughput)?
help_text: Performance SLAs drive acceptance criteria for tests
example_answer: We require <200ms response time and 10k requests per second throughput

text: What security testing will you perform (OWASP, penetration testing)?
help_text: Security testing identifies vulnerabilities before production
example_answer: We will perform OWASP Top 10 testing, penetration testing, and dependency scanning

text: How will you automate security testing in the CI/CD pipeline?
help_text: Automated security testing catches vulnerabilities early
example_answer: We will use SAST tools, dependency scanning, and container image scanning

text: How will you implement testing in your CI/CD pipeline?
help_text: CI/CD integration ensures tests run automatically on every commit
example_answer: We will run unit tests, integration tests, and security scans on every push

text: What is your acceptable build time and test execution time?
help_text: Build time impacts development velocity and feedback speed
example_answer: We target <10 minutes for full test suite to keep developer feedback fast
